rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A collection of tracks, often by the same artist, that are typically sold as a vinyl record or a CD.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an album with a web page where one can buy or download this album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Buy or Download Web page

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an album to the primary recording artist of the album. Note that this property should be single-valued, except in the case of split albums. Note too that this property should not be used in cases of compilation albums featuring various artists.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property linking an album to a musical composition which is recorded on the album. Note that this property should be used only in cases where the entire album is dedicated to the composition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compositions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an album to a standard descriptor for the type of music recorded on the album, e.g. soundtrack or live album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Type
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use type.object.type and the type representing the kind of album. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property linking an album to information about the people who contributed to the music recorded on the album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contributor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links an album to a recording engineer who was responsible for the album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Engineer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.album to the mso:music.artist(s) with a billing of 'featured' on the album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Featured Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to a standard descriptor for a category of musical traditions or conventions, e.g. rhythm and blues and madrigal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to a number indicating the length of the album in seconds.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Running Time

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to the album by the same artist that immediately follows the first album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Next Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to the number of tracks on the album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Tracks

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to an action of playing the album on an electronic device.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Play Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to a webpage that plays all of the tracks of the album in sequence.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Play Link

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:music.album to the mso:common.popularity relationship collecting data about the album's popularity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album Popularity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to the album by the same artist that immediately precedes the first album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Previous Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to he first release of the album or, in cases of simultaneous issues, the one regarded as most canonical. One of the primary uses of this property is to allow users to query for the songs or tracks on an album, without having to worry about, for example, the extra or variants tracks often included on reissues or releases in different countries.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Primary Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating an album to the company or imprint of a company that released the album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Record Label

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to the date that the album was first released.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Initial Release Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to a standard descriptor for the type of album, e.g. EP or Compilation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album Type
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: This property is not needed. Use type.object.type and a subtype of music.album or music.release to indicate release type. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates an album to one of the releases of the album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Releases

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A specification or refinement of the genre of the album. Note that, if only one genre is given for the album, the property mso:music.album.genre should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subgenre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an album to a concert tour by the artist that is promoting the album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Supporting Tours

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates an album to a recording that is included on the album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album Track
Musical Album Type
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not needed. Use a subtype of music.album or music.release instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Stores that specialize in selling physical recordings of music, on vinyl records and/or on CDs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album Store

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A particular adaptation or version of abstract musical content, viz. music.composition. Arrangements typically modify the melodic, harmonic or rhythmic structure of a composition. Some examples are the orchestral version of George Gershwin's Rhapsody in Blue or Joe Cocker's version of the Beatles' song With a Little Help from my Friends.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Arrangement

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links an arrangement to the composition or one of the compositions on which the arrangement is based.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Arrangement of

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A musical artist is an individual or a group that performs or makes music. Musical artists typically perform in front of an audience on a regular basis and/or record musical tracks or musical albums.
Things that are musical artists:
## Individuals that perform as solo acts such as singers, guitarists, saxophonists, etc. (e.g. Alicia Keys, Carlos Santana, Rudy Weidoeft).
## Musical groups (e.g. The Medallions, D12, Brown University Band, Brooklyn Tabernacle Choir ).
## Musicians and groups that have not released musical albums but regularly perform in front of an audience, such as in music festivals, concerts and tours (e.g. Cormac McCarthy, Mariachi Rosas Divinas).
## Musical projects (e.g. Era, Pain).
Things that are NOT musical artists:
## Any person who can has not released any musical albums/tracks and does not regularly perform at concerts. A good example would be Bill Clinton, a former U.S. president and a saxophone player.
## Songwriters, composers, and librettists (e.g. Franz Schubert, Lorenzo Da Ponte). Use mso:music.composer or one of its subtypes in these cases.
## Individuals who have released albums that are not musical in nature, such as comedy albums and audio books (e.g. George Carlin, Charles Laughton).
## Disc jockeys and video jockeys (e.g. Jason Mizell, Paul van Dyk, Ananda Lewis).
## Musical organizations that are primarily concerned with training other musicians (e.g. Temple Square Chorale).
## Dancers who have released musical albums and compilations of musical tracks performed by persons other than themselves.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to a web page where one can buy or download recordings by the artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Web Page for Music

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to the date on which this artist ceased activity as a musician.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: End of Music Artist's Career

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to information about when the artist was active. Note that this property is multivalued, because a music artist may have more than one active period.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active Period

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to the date on which this artist first became active as a musician.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Start of Music Artist's Career

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music artist to an album on which the artist is a primary recording artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to a free text description of the contact information for the artist's booking agent.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Booking Contact Information

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.artist to an instance of mso:broadcast.content in which the musical artist, either a band or individual, appeared. This property includes the musical guests of 'Saturday Night Live' and the performers of the half-time show of any given Super Bowl.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Broadcast

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical artist to an action of buying a ticket to an event that features the artist, e.g. a concert.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Buy Ticket

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music artist to concert tours featuring the artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Tours

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music artist to information about the albums in which the artist has taken a part and in what capacity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contribution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music artist to another artist who was influenced by the group or person.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Followers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to the general manager for the artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: General Manager

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to a standard descriptor for a category of musical traditions or conventions, e.g. rhythm and blues and madrigal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: official home page for this artist
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Artist Home Page

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Artists that have influenced this artist or group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Influences

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musician to a musical instrument that is regularly played by the musical artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Instruments Played

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Interests of this artist or group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interests
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The intended meaning of this property is not clear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a music artist to a music artist that is appreciated by the person or group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Likes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a music artist to the place where the person's or group's musical career began (not necessarily the place of birth).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Origin

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical artist to an action of playing a sound recording by the artist, e.g. a track or album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Play Music

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to a free text description of the contact information for the artist's press representative.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Press Contact Information

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical artist to information about the ranking of their albums.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ranked Albums by Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical artist to information about the ranking of their recorded tracks.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ranked Tracks by Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating an album to a company or an imprint of a company that released recording works created by the artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Record Label

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a mso:music.artist to another mso:music.artist that is considered similar.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Similar Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to a standard descriptor for a musical style that the artist exemplifies. Unlike musical genre, style represents creative decisions of artists and thier aesthetic and personal music choices in the music that they create.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Style

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A specification or refinement of the genre of the musical artist. Note that, if only one genre is given for the artist, the property mso:music.artist.genre should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subgenre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music artist to a musician who has performed live or on recordings with this artist. Note that, in the case of music groups, this property should only be used for musicians who are not also members of the group. This includes members of a band whose name includes the name of one of the members of the band, such as Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Supporting Artists

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music artist to a track on which the artist has primary creative responsibility.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Track

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music artist to information about the tracks in which the artist has taken a part and in what capacity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Track Contributions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.artist to the mso:music.artist that is a tribute act of the former.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tribute Acts

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all bassists. Bassists are musicians who play one of the bass instruments, e.g. the double bass, bass guitar, or keyboard bass.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bassist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An album that consists of tracks that were originally issued on various albums, either by one artist or by several different artists.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compilation Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A person, group or organization that writes musical pieces.
Things that are a Composer:
## Classical music composers (e.g. Franz Schubert, B??la Bart??k, Sadarang).
## Modern music composers, including contemporary classical, pop, jazz, and rock music composers (e.g. Lorenzo Ferrero, Sangtar, John Cale).
## Commercial jingle composers (e.g. Steve Carmen, Dick Marx).
## Video game music composers (e.g. Nobuo Uematso, Yasunori Mitsuda).
## Film music composers (e.g. Henry Mancini, Don Davis, Michael Small, Yuvan Shankar Raja).
## Musical play composers (e.g. Jeanine Tesori, Stephen Schwartz). Note that mso:theater.theatrical_composer is the more specific type in these cases.
## Opera composers (e.g. Umberto Giordano, Jules Massenet, Ruggero Leoncavallo).
## Musical arrangers (e.g. William Brohn, Ray Ellis).
## People who write lyrics for musical compositions (e.g. Peppino Turco, Ira Gershwin, Dick Manning). Note that mso:music.lyricist is the more specific type for these.
Things that are NOT composers:
## Musical performers (e.g. The Flaming Lips, Radiohead, Yves Montand, Marie N). Use music.musical_artist in these cases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Composer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a composer to a composition created by the composer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compositions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
The abstract content of a piece of music, including both the score and the lyrics in the case of songs. Note that music.composition applies to all types of musical pieces, whether orchestral compositions, pop songs, instrumental solos, etc. A composition may include smaller compositions such as arias, movements, etc. (e.g. the composition Der Ring des Nibelungen includes the smaller compositions Das Rheingold, Die Walkure, Siegfried and G??tterd??mmerung).
Things that are compositions:
## Musical arrangements ranging from baroque symphonies to commercial jingles (e.g. Symphony No. 5, La Clemenza di Tito, Highway Star, Victory Fanfare).
## Original compositions and arrangements (e.g. Reason to Believe, Baby I Love Your Way) as well as classical parodies (e.g The Carnival of Animals).
Things that are NOT compositions:
## Musical tracks should not be typed as compositions. A composition is a more general concept than a musical track which represents a particular recording of a song. For instance, there is only one song or composition ???I Will Always Love You,??? but there are many musical tracks with that title (e.g. I Will Always Love You by Dolly Parton and I Will Always Love You by Whitney Houston). Use mso:music.track for musical tracks.
## Musical plays are not compositions, but the songs that are parts of musical plays are compositions. For instance, the play Annie is not a musical composition, but the songs used in it, such as Tomorrow and It's a Hard Knock Life, are compositions.
## Poems and any written work with parts adapted to songs (e.g. To Celia, Gadji Beri Bimba). Use mso:book.written_work in these cases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Composition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a musical composition to one of its arrangements.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Arrangements

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to the person or one of the people who wrote the composition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Composer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to a standard descriptor for the type of composition, e.g. symphony, tone poem, concerto, string quartet, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compositional Form

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to the legally recognized creator of the composition. Note that the value of this property is a string, because for legal reasons the credit must be shown exactly as originally expressed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Credit

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to the date when the composition was finished by the composer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date Completed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to the date that the composition was first performed in public.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date of First Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to a smaller composition which is a part of it, e.g. a movement of a symphony.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Includes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to the original language or languages of the lyrics, if any, of the composition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a composition to a lyricist that wrote or contributed to the writing of the lyrics for the composition. Note that, generally speaking, this property is used only when the score and the lyrics of a song were written by different people.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lyricist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a musical composition to the text of the lyrics, if any, of the composition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lyrics Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a musical composition to a website that provides the lyrics, if any, of the composition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lyrics Website
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: If this property is needed, a value of the enumeration mso:common.webpage_label should be created. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:type.object.webpage]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to the key, mode, or scale that the composition uses, e.g. F major.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Scale

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a musical composition to another composition that contains it, e.g. one of the movements of a symphony.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Part of

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a musical composition to the location or locations where the composer wrote the composition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Place Composed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a musical composition to the location where the composition was first performed. This can be a performance venue, a city, or a larger area if the city is not known.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Place of First Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to a standard descriptor for the speed with which the composition should be played, e.g. "allegro", "andante" or "lento".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Qualitative Tempo

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to an album which primarily or entirely consists of a recording of the composition. This property is typically used for symphonies and other multi-part compositions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recorded as Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical composition to a thing, person, or event that is a focus of the composition, e.g. John Kennedy, World War II, Seattle, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subject

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a musical composition to a track which is a complete recording of the composition. Note that when a single composition is recorded as an entire album, the property music.composition.recorded_as_album should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Track

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for types of compositions, e.g. symphony, tone poem, concerto, string quartet, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compositional Form

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a compositional form to a composition that exemplifies the form.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compositions
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: This property creates a data skew and is not needed. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:music.composition.compositional_form]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Compositional form(s) of which this form is a sub-form.
A public performance of a musical composition or set of compositions by one or more musical artists.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert to a film of the concert.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert to information about who performed at the concert and the roles that they played.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert to information about which compositions were performed at the concert and who performed them.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Set List

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a concert to a tour, if any, of which the concert is a part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Tour

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a concert to the price of a ticket to attend the concert.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cost

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert to an album which consists primarily or exclusively of a recording of the concert.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Live Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a concert to the performance venue where the concert was held.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Venue

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A film which is devoted primarily or exclusively to a concert, e.g. the famous Woodstock film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a concert film to the concert that it records.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a concert film to the concert tour of which the corresponding concert is a part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Tour

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about a particular performance at a concert, i.e. who performed and who roles they played in the performance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the featured music artist of the performance. Note that the property mso:music.concert_performance.band_members should be used for music artists that play a supporting role in the performance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies a music artist who played a supporting role in the performance. Note that the property mso:music.concert_performance.artist should be used for featured music artists.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Band Members
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: This property is not needed. The property music.concert_performance.artist can be used to specify an artist, and music.concert_performance.concert_performance_role can be used to specify that it is a supporting role. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:music.concert_performance.artist]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies the concert containing the performance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property specifying the role that the music artist played in the performance, e.g. supporting artist and headlining artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for roles that music artists play in a performance, e.g. supporting artist and headlining artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Performance Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about which compositions were performed at a concert and who performed them.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Set List

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that specifies a featured artist of the given song.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies the concert where the song was performed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies a music artist that performed with the main act on a small number of pieces in the concert. This should not include backing musicians of the main act(s). An example is an opera singer who performs a single aria in an otherwise instrumental-only classical concert. Note that in the case where a band played 10 songs themselves and then were joined by a guest artist for the eleventh song, the eleventh song, but not the first ten, would be entered using this property.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Guest Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies a composition performed by the music artists during the concert.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Song

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A series of related concerts by a musical artist that occur at different places over a particular time interval.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Tour

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert tour to an album that is associated with the concert tour.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert tour to the musical artist that is making the tour.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert tour to a concert that is part of the tour.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert tour to a film that is primarily or exclusively devoted to the concert tour or to a concert that is part of the tour.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert tour to the total amount of income generated by the tour.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gross Proceeds

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a concert tour to an album that consists primarily or exclusively of recordings made during the concert tour.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Live Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.concert_tour to the number of different segments of the concert.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Legs

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.concert_tour to the total number of concerts in the concert tour.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Shows

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a concert tour to the person who is responsible for organizing the tour.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tour Manager

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A small group of musicians who are led by a conductor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conducted Ensemble

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a conducted ensemble to information about the people who have conducted the group and at what times.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conductors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that collects information about conducting positions, viz. who held them, when they were held, and the relevant music ensembles.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conducting Tenure

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies he group conducted by the person during the given time period.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ensemble

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the person who conducted the group during the given time period.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conductor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the start of the period during which the person conducted the group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the end of the period during which the person conducted the group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who is responsible for directing the musicians of a conducted ensemble.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conductor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a conductor to information about the conducted ensembles that he or she led and when he or she led them.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Groups

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a conductor to an opera production which he or she conducted.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Operas Conducted

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing types of content for albums, including types like soundtrack, live album, and studio album.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Content Type
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is unnecessary, since we already have types to represent the different kinds of albums. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all drummers. Drummers are musicians who play the drums, including individual hand drums and drum kits.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drummer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who specializes in recording, manipulating, mixing, and reproducing sound.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recording Engineer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a recording engineer to an album on which he or she worked.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album Engineered

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a recording engineer to a release on which he or she worked.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Engineered

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating an mso:music.engineer to a mso:music.track the engineer worked on.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tracks Engineered

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all music festivals. Unlike a concert which is of a limited duration, usually a few hours, a music festival is of longer duration, sometimes an entire day or week, and features a variety of performances by different performers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Festival

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.festival to the mso:music.genre(s) associated with the festival.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all musical festival events, which are self-contained parts of a mso:music.festival. For example, the individual performances of a festival would be festival events.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Festival Event

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.festival_event to an mso:music.artist that participated in the event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for categories of musical traditions or conventions, e.g. rhythm and blues and madrigal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: genre(s) considered to be within this genre
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subgenres

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A musical group is a musical artist that consists of more than one person. Instances can include everything from pop duos to orchestras and artists that only record or publicly perform together once. When multiple individual artists collaborate, they should be typed as a musical group only if there is a name for the group.
Things that are musical groups:
## Duos (e.g. Simon and Garfunkel).
## Artists that have never recorded (e.g. The Tonight Show Band under bandleader Kevin Eubanks).
## A backing band that plays with different soloists (e.g. The Dap Kings who play behind Sharon Jones and Amy Winehouse).
## Orchestras (e.g. The New York Philharmonic).
## Groups that preform together only once but have a group name (e.g. USA for Africa, the artists that recorded the original "We Are The World").
## Casts of musicals (e.g. the cast of Mamma Mia).
Things that are NOT musical groups:
## Solo artists (e.g. Michael Bubl??). Use mso:music.musician or mso:music.singer in these cases.
## Groups of musical people who are not performers (e.g. Gilbert and Sullivan and Rodgers and Hammerstein)
## Collaborating artists (e.g. Elton John and the artists on his "Duets" album).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Group

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.group to the mso:location.location in which the group formed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Formed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music group to information about the members of the group, when they were members, and in what capacity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Member

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical group to information about the supergroups or collaborations involving various musical bands in which the given group has participated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Supergroup

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about membership in music groups, viz. who was a member, when was he or she a member, and what role did he or she play in the group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Group Membership

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies when the member left the group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: End

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the music group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Group

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the relevant member of the group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Member

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property specifying a group that is a member of a supergroup or collaboration between various bands, for example. The supergroup or collaboration is given by the property mso:music.group_membership.group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Member Group

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies an instrument or vocal role that the member played in the group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies when the member first joined the group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Start

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all guitars, the six stringed instruments played by strumming or plucking the strings.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Guitar

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a brand or model of a guitar to its distributor/manufacturer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Brand

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a brand or model of a guitar to a guitarist who is known for playing the brand or model.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Guitarist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all guitarists. Guitarists are musicians who play the guitar, including electric, acoustic, classical, and bass guitars.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Guitarist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a guitarist to a guitar that the musician plays or has played.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Guitars Played

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all musical instruments. Musical instruments are devices used to produce musical sounds.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Instrument

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: the family of instruments to which this one belongs
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Family

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A store that specializes in selling instruments that are used to produce music, e.g. brass instruments, woodwinds, and string instruments.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Instrument Store

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A performance venue that specializes in jazz music.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Jazz Club

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A performance venue where the performers are members of the audience who provide the vocal accompaniment to live or recorded music.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Karaoke Bar

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An album that was recorded in the presence of an audience, e.g. an album that was recording during a concert.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Live Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a live album to the concert where the album was recorded.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a live album to the concert tour during which the album was recorded.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concert Tour

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person, group or organization that writes words that are put to music. Lyricists include both people who wrote lyrics specifically for a piece of music (often in collaboration with a composer or for a piece they themselves have composed or for a piece of pre-existing music) and people who wrote poetry or prose that was not originally intended to be sung, but which was later set to music. This means that a song can have a composer and a lyricist who were not contemporaries of each other.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lyricist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:music.lyricist to an mso:music.composition for which the lyricist has written, or contributed to writing, the lyrics.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lyrics Written

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for the general makeup of physical media used to distribute audio recordings, e.g. gramophone record, DVD, CD, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Media Format

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing music releases that consist of more than one component, e.g. a DVD set or a double LP. Note that a release consisting of multiple tracks is not for that reason considered a multi-part release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Multi-Part Music Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a multi-part release to one of its components, e.g. one of the discs making up the set.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Component

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all events in which music is the focus. Included in this type are music concerts, tours, and music festivals.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Event

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musical event to an artistic director of the event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artistic Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music event to a music genre associated with the event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An audiovisual recording whose soundtrack is an individual song and which is intended to promote the song.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music video to the music artist whose song is featured in the video. Note that the artist may not be performing the song in the video.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music video to the person who designed the choreography that appears in the music video.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Choreographer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music video to the director of the music video.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Directed by

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music video to the date that the video was first aired/made available to the public.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Initial Release Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music video to a standard descriptor for a genre that the video exemplifies, e.g. concert performance, comedy, parody, dystopian, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music video to a thing, person, or event that is a focus of the music video, e.g. John Kennedy, World War II, Seattle, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Subject

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music video to information about the people who performed in the video and the roles that they played.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates the music video to the composition that is the soundtrack of the video and whose recordings are promoted by the video.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Song

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for performing roles in a music video, e.g. guitarist and drummer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: There is no need for this type. Just use people.person instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:people.person]
There is no need for this type. Just use people.person instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:people.person]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who specializes in directing music videos.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for genres of music videos.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the crew members who supported the production of a music video, viz. who they were and what roles they played.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Gig

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the person who worked on the music video production in the role of lighting, set designer, gaffer, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Crewmember

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the relevant music video.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the role that the crewmember played in the production of the music video, e.g. set artist or video editor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Crew Production Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for supporting roles in producing a music video.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Job

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the performers in the music video, viz. who they were and what roles they played.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the character that the person played in the music video performance, e.g. bassist, guitarist, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the person or animal that performed in the music video.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Video Performer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Notes about this performance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance note

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the type of performance, e.g. dancing, singing, voice acting, motion capture model for animation, appearance from archival footage, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Special Music Video Performance Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Person or animal that appears in the music video in some role (either acting, singing, cameo appearance, etc.).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music video performer
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: There is no need for this type. Use people.person instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:people.person]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Subject or topic represented in a music video.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music video subject
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use mso:media_common.subject as this item will no longer be supported. DeprecatedBy:[jcoop] Successor:[mso:media_common.subject]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for kinds of musical chords, e.g. Neapolitan chord and harmonic seventh chord.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Chord

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A company that manufactures and/or distributes musical instruments.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Instrument Company

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for the scales that are used in musical compositions, e.g. F major.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Scale

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all musicians. Musicians are those people that play a musical instrument, usually as a profession or on a professional level.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musician

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a musician to a music artist for whom the musician has played in a supporting role.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artists Supported

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a musician to information about the music groups with which the musician has been affiliated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Group Membership

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a musician to a musical instrument that is regularly played by the musician.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Instruments Played

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The voice part(s) sung by this musician, if any
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Vocal Range

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all entertainment venues operating late, usually with a dance floor and DJ booth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Nightclub

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all opera singers. An opera singer is a singer who performs and/or records operatic compositions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Opera Singer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links an opera singer to information about the performances of the singer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Opera Roles
Orchestra
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not needed, since it seems to have the same meaning as music.conducted_ensemble. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:music.conducted_ensemble]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for roles in performing music, e.g. lead singer and background vocals.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Performance Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A location which is intended for concerts and other music performances.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance Venue

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a performance venue to a concert that was or will be held at the venue.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Concerts

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
Primary entity representing the collection of all music producers. Producers are those agents that oversee and manage the recording of a mso:music.music_artist's music. This work includes the creative and practical day-to-day activities such as controlling the recording sessions, coaching and guiding the performers, and supervising the recording, mixing and mastering processes.
People who are record producers:
## People who produce music (e.g. Nick Tauber, Koolade, Ric Wake).
## Groups that produce music (e.g. Dead Executives, The Matrix, Bloodshy & Avant).
## Companies and organizations that produce music (e.g. Soundforth, Maratone, Jesuit Music Ministry).
## Musical artists who produce music, whether for themselves or for other musicians (e.g Dave Fridmann, Gustavo Santaolalla, The Cooper Temple Clause, Europe).
## Audio engineers who are also record producers (e.g. Eddie Kramer, Charlie Bauerfeind, Humberto Gatica).
People who are NOT record producers:
## Recording engineers who are not record producers (e.g. Chuck Britz, Rudy Van Gelder). Use mso:music.engineer for these.
## Producers of non-music recordings such as bird calling tracks, humpback whales, and audio foley sound effects (e.g. Roger Payne, Dick Mills, Jeffery Boswall).
## Music and concert promoters (e.g. Raymond Gubbay, Alexis Rivera, Bill Graham, Leo Mintz).
## Music editors (e.g. Sally Boldt, Michael Pacek, Paul Intson).
## Companies that finance music albums (e.g. Bad Boy Records, 3D Vision Records, Formation Records). Use mso:music.record_label for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Producer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music producer to an album that he or she produced.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album Produced

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music producer to a music release that he or she produced.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music producer to a track that he or she produced.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tracks Produced

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that contains standard descriptors for the speed with which a musical composition should be played, e.g. "allegro", "andante", "lento",
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Qualitative Tempo

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A company or an imprint of a company that creates, markets, and distributes music recordings, e.g. albums and singles.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Record Label

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a record label to an album released under the label.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.record_label to a genre that the label produces.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about a music artist's recorded performance on an album, including the role played in the performance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recording Contribution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the album to which the artist contributed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the recording artist contributing to the project.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contributor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the role that the artist played in the project, e.g. lead singer or background vocals.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that contains the variants or editions of an album, single or other music commodity. For example, an album may be rereleased after, say, 20 years or an album may have a slightly different collection of tracks for certain markets.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a music release to a web page where one can buy or download the release. Note that a play link may be part of an acquire webpage, but such a webpage will often also contain other information, e.g. photos, album notes, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Acquire Web Page

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music release to its corresponding album, if any. Although in the vast majority of cases a release will correspond to a single album, there are some exceptions. For example, two or more albums might be rereleased as part of a box set (e.g. the Beatles Complete, which is a rerelease of every album issued by the Beatles). In cases like this, the release corresponds to multiple albums.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music release to a music artist that has creative responsibility for the release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music release to a person who was involved in recording, manipulating, mixing or reproducing sound for the release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Engineers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.release to a mso:music.artist that was featured on the release, e.g. one who has primary or exclusive creative responsibility for the release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Featured Artists

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a music release the length of the release in seconds of playing time.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a music release to a standard descriptor for the general makeup of the physical media that is used to distribute the release, e.g. gramophone record, DVD, CD, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Format

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a music release to a webpage which allows one to play the given release. Note that a play link may be part of an acquire webpage, but such a webpage will often also contain other information, e.g. photos, album notes, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Play Link

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:music.release to the mso:common.popularity relationship collecting information about the popularity of the release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Popularity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property linking a music release to a producer of the release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Producers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music release to a record company or an imprint of a record company that issued the release
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Record Label

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a music release to the market where the release was sold.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Region

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music release to the date that the release was issued.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: the kind of release which this album is
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release type
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: This property is not needed. Use type.object.type and a subtype of music.album or music.release to indicate release type. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:music.release to the mso:music.release_track(s) on this release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Track List

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing music releases that are components of other music releases, e.g. a disc that is part of a DVD set. Note that a release consisting of multiple tracks is not for that reason considered a multi-part release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Release Component

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:music.release_component to its mso:music.multipart_release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Package

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A release of a recorded music track. A release track can differ from the canonical version of a recorded track with respect to length, expurgated content or position on a compilation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Track

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a release track to a web page where one can buy or download the release track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Web Page
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use type.object.webpage and common.webpage_label.download instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:type.object.webpage]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a release track to the length of the release track in seconds. Note that this may differ from the length of the related track, since there is some degree of variability in the length of a given recording on different releases and media.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a release track to a URL that will play the release track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Track Play link

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:music.release_track to the mso:common.popularity relationship collecting data about the release track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Track Popularity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a release track to its corresponding track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recording

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a release track to a larger release, e.g. an album release, of which the release track is a part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates whether or not the release track is a remix of the original track. If set to 1, the property indicates that the release track is an edit of the original track. If set to 0, it indicates that the release track is not an edit of the original.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Remix

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a release track to its number on a larger release, e.g. an album release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Track #

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A music artist who uses his or her voice to perform and/or record musical compositions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Singer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a singer to a standard descriptor for a type of singing voice, e.g. Alto or Soprano.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Vocal Range

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A collection of two music tracks, the a-side and the b-side.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Single

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a single to the first side of the single.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Single A-side

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a single to the second side of the single.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Single B-Side

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.single to the mso:music.artist that was featured on the single.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Featured Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a single to a particular release of the single.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music Single Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.single to the music.track that is a version of the single. These are the other recordings of this single by the artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Versions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all songwriters. Songwriters are composers who write both tunes and lyrics.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Songwriter

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An album that contains recordings of music that accompanied a particular movie or theater production.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soundtrack

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a soundtrack album to its corresponding movie.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a soundtrack album to its corresponding opera.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Opera

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a soundtrack album to its corresponding play.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Play

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soundtrack to an action of playing the soundtrack on an electric/electronic device.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Play Soundtrack

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a soundtrack album to its corresponding theatrical production.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Production

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a soundtrack album to its corresponding television program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Television Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for special performing roles in a music video, e.g. bandmember, dancer, a cameo appearance, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Special Music Video Performance Type
Musical style
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: It is not clear how this type differs from music.genre. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:music.genre]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An electronic music instrument that can generate a wide variety of sounds and is typically played with a keyboard.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Synthesizer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a synthesizer to the company that manufactures and/or distributes the synthesizer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Brand

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all tour managers. These are the people responsible for organizing music tours.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tour Manager

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property linking a tour manager to a tour that he or she managed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tours Managed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A recording of a musical composition by a particular person or group of persons. For example, a live or studio recording of a song.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Track

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a music track to a web page where one can buy or download the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Acquire Webpage

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to an album on which the track appears.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to a music artist that has creative responsibility for the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music track to information about the roles played by the artists who contributed to the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contributions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates whether the track was performed by an artist other than the original performing artist. If set to 0, it indicates that the track was performed by the original performing artist. If set to 1, it indicates that the track was performed by another artist.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cover

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to the date on which the track was recorded.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date Recorded

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to a recording engineer who worked on the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Engineer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:music.track to a mso:music.artist that was featured on the track, e.g. one who has primary or exclusive creative responsibility for the release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Featured Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to a standard descriptor for a category of musical traditions or conventions, e.g. rhythm and blues and madrigal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music track to the international standard recording code for the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISRC Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to the length of the track in seconds.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to a webpage that contains lyrics for the song that is recorded on the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lyrics Website

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to the location, e.g. studio, city, or country, where the track was recorded.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Place Recorded

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to a webpage that plays the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Play Link

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to an act of playing the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Play Track

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:music.track to the mso:common.popularity relationship collecting data about the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Track Popularity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to the album on which the track first appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Primary Album

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to the first release of the track or, in cases of simultaneous issues, the track regarded as canonical. This will typically be the full-length or unexpurgated version of the recording.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Primary Release Track

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track to a producer responsible for the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Producer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a music track, i.e. a particular recording of a song, to the appearance of the track on a particular release, e.g. of an album. Each appearance of a track on a release should have a separate release track. For example, if a recording appears on six releases of an album, it has six release tracks.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Track

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a music track to a multi-track release, e.g. of an album, that contains the track.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Releases

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a track to a single on which the track appears, as either the a-side or the b-side.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Single

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:music.track to the mso:music.composition of which the track is a recording.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Song

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A specification or refinement of the genre of the track. Note that, if only one genre is given for the track, the property mso:music.track.genre should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subgenre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about a music artist's performance on a recorded track, including the role played in the performance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Track Contribution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the recording artist contributing to the project.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the role that the artist played in the project, e.g. lead singer or background vocals.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the track to which the artist contributed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Track

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for types of musical voices, e.g. alto, soprano, bass, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Voice

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a standard descriptor for a kind of musical voice to a singer who has this kind of voice.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Singers
